content.question: Two identical wheels, wheel 1 and wheel 2, initially at rest begin to rotate with constant angular accelerations <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. After rotating through the same angular displacement, <math alttext="delta theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , the angular velocity of wheel 1 is <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the angular velocity of wheel 2 is <math alttext="omega sub 2 equals 3 omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . How does the angular acceleration of wheel 2, <math alttext="alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, compare to the angular acceleration of wheel 1, <math alttext="alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha sub 2 equals alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub 2 equals alpha sub 1 over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub 2 equals 3 alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub 2 equals 9 alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="alpha sub 2 equals 9 alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><msub><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
